title.narrative: CERF (Central Emergency Response Fund) and Sudden Onset

description.narrative: As a flexible and fully un-earmarked humanitarian pooled fund it is also well aligned with Ireland’s Grand Bargain commitment to un-earmarked funding. It is proposed to continue to support the UN's Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) in 2017. In order to address any sudden onset crisis or emergency that may arise in 2017, a humanitarian funding reserve is maintained to ensure that Ireland is in a position to respond rapidly and flexibly, either through a call for proposals or bilateral engagement with a pre-identified partner, depending on which organisations are best placed to respond. Humanitarian Unit may proactively initiate a ‘Call for Proposals’ to NGOs through the Dóchas Humanitarian Aid Working Group (HAWG) to respond rapidly and effectively to a sudden onset disaster or to a deterioration in a protracted emergency situation, as and when needed.

Established in 2006, the CERF allocates funds at the most critical phase of an emergency – to kick start a humanitarian response, to respond to a sudden deterioration of a crisis, or to deliver life- saving humanitarian assistance in protracted crises that fail to attract sufficient resources.
